result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian D. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $10,000.00 plus surcharges as stipulated to plus $1,500.00 which is to be determined through restitution hearing.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with known felons or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  Maintain a stable residence.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and victim appears by phone.  Statement is given by victim and sentencing arguments are made and 15CF949 is read in.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Defendant is sentenced to 14 years in the WSP forthwith; 8 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 506 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $10,000 which is stipulated to by parties plus additional $1500 for investigation costs which is not stipulated to by parties as there has been no documentation provided to parties.  Restitution hearing to be scheduled before Comm. Dowse regarding the disputed amount and DE's appearance may be waived for that hearing at the request of Atty Barth.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Parties stipulate to adjournment of trial; no objection by Judge Kerkman.  JSH on 2/18/16 and JT on 2/22/16 re removed from the calendar.  Dates changed to JSH 4/28/16 at 1:00 and JT 5/2/16 at 8:30.  Parties notified by email.

Upon hearing further statements made by parties court grants DE's motion to withdraw his previous plea.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Evidentiary Hearing rescheduled to 11/4/15 at 1:30 PM and confirmed with Atty Jensen.  Atty Jensen to provide notice to DE.
Court has reviewd and approves Atty Jensen's request for adjournment with no objection by the State.

Defendant Adrian D. Moore appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1: Robbery of a Financial Institution, Use of a Dangerous Weapon; found guilty by the court. Presentence Investigation ordered. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 10, 2015 at 09:10 am.
